Author: Xichekolas
Content:
Well with what you describe, the graph would become the commodity, the sites themselves would remain unique and competitive, but as interfaces to the graph.

Overall I think your idea sounds like a win for all. Users could have a single presence at the site of their choice, with friends from other sites, new entrants would have a lower barrier of entry, and existing sites are less likely to lose users to the network effect. Of course, the big players would probably have more competition from niche players too, so I guess that would be the downside for Myspace and Facebook.

Author: cstejerean
Content: Personally I wouldn't recommend Romania as a place to do a startup yet, at least not to incorporate in Romania. I moved to the US from Romania about 7 years ago and while some things have improved in the mean time I think the current system in Romania would impose too many road bloacks for a startup. Great place however to outsource.

Author: Xichekolas
Content:
From the actual filing with the SEC:

"International Revenues - Revenues from outside of the United States totaled $2.03 billion, representing 48% of total revenues in the third quarter of 2007, [...] Had foreign exchange rates remained constant from the third quarter of 2006 through the third quarter of 2007, our revenues in the third quarter of 2007 would have been $121 million lower."

Additionally, their total reported profit (net income is the figure that increased 46%, so I will assume that is what they mean by 'profit') was $1.07B. If you assume that the $121M due to forex was pure gravy, then their pre-forex profit was $949M. This is still a 29.5% increase on a year earlier (when their profit was $733M in the third quarter).

Author: jgrahamc
Content:
That is related because as I was debugging my scripts I figured I'd use the Microsoft Script Debugger. Big freakin' mistake. The debugger crashed and took IE with it.

I use OS X most of the time and Linux most of the rest of the time. Every time I go back to Windows to do something Microsoft finds a way of kicking me in the teeth.

John.

Author: jsjenkins168
Content:
While it might be difficult to give reasons based simply on an application, I'm sure there are valid reasons for an interview rejection. That would be very useful information to know.

Although I understand many of the reasons are probably due to simply not being compelled by the founders, which is much more difficult to tell someone than simply that "there are too many competitors".

The truth can hurt, but sometimes that is what someone really needs to hear.

Author: Xichekolas
Content:
Well I'm sure that forex had a slight positive effect. My point was that it wasn't the only cause of the increased profits. The fact that revenues are up 57% and profit is only up 46% with the slight forex leverage probably signals that they are getting big enough that their margins are falling off. I would guess that is why it is only up 1.2% (as of close of market) on such a huge increase. The other reason probably has to do with the generally bad day on the market today.

Of course, seeing it around $650 makes me wish I hadn't sold all mine at $425. ;)
